lines.text: Chester. You just went through a stop sign.
I can't help it. I don't like to read when I drive.
If you're innocent, they'll never send you to jail.
Is that how it works, Chester?
Not in my neighborhood.

[after Ira punches out Nicholas]
Are you crazy? Are you out of your mind? Who's going to serve the coffee now?
Are you saying you may not become Attorney General if I make Veal Parmesan?
No, I'm just saying with your ex-husband on the loose we're alot safer, with Chicken Pepperoni!
Alright! I'll make it. Only don't make me crazy, I can't cook when I'm crazy.
I'm not making you crazy...
Yes, you are! Anyone who forces me to make Chicken Pepperoni is making me crazy, and you, are making me crazy!
[She exits]
I'm not making her crazy.
Your Honor, this is the kind of testimony that looks silly on the surface.
On the surface, in the middle, and on the bottom.
Can I ask you something, Mr. Gardenia?
If I can be of any help in this matter, Judge, it's my pleasure.
Were you apprehended or did you surrender?
I surrendered.
He was apprehended.
He was apprehended after he surrendered.
He didn't surrender to me, therefore he was apprehended.
He was going to surrender after dinner. I told him to wait in the kitchen.

[Drops pencil in disgust]
And did you stay in the kitchen?
No, I had to serve dinner.
You were serving dinner to the district attorney and his wife?
Uh-huh... and the Governor.
The Governor? OUR Governor?
I didn't ask him. He *looked* like our governor.
Your Honor, if we're going to get into such trivialities like our guest list, we might as well discuss what was served.
Chicken pepperoni, your Honor. The Governor seemed to like it if it has any bearing on the case.

Hold it hold it... would you just hold it? Are you trying to tell me that while every policeman in the state was looking for you, YOU were serving dinner to the district attorney, his wife and our governor?
[Chuckles in disbelief]
How is that possible?
Well... you have to prepare everything in advance.
What should I do Ira?
What should he do about what.
The chicken, Fred is a vegetarian and doesn't know if he should eat it.
Eat the chicken Fred.
Mrs. Parks.
WHAT!
Don't snap at me.
I'm sorry, I have a headache through my entire body.
Know you remember where this gun is.
Right side middle of the ribs
What will it be boys
Fill it up
Fill it up
Regular or Premium?
Regular
Premium!
Premium will be fine
Do you want me to check the hood
Yea
No
No its already been checked. Thanks.
We're going to have a serious conversation tonight.
I'm looking forward to it.
Anything special you'd like for dinner?
Is this a gag?
This is a government agency... you know we don't have a sense of humor.

[looks right into camera]
Oh Sh**!

[looks at Gardenia's image coming off printer]
Jeee-sus!
Disbarment. Disbarment and disgrace are all that lies ahead.

[looking ahead]
That and a big truck.
Then we have boy, girl, boy, girl, Governor, girl!
No kiss, Nick. I'm a married woman with a Governor inside.
Notice how I remain calm? That's why I'm the Governor.
Something fascinating has just come up, which in this case is redundant.
How'd we do boss?
We won in overtime. And don't call me boss, didn't you see Roots? Chester, where'd you get that hat?
From a chauffeur.
You stole it.
No, I found it.
Where?
On a chauffeur.
Chester, the only reason I made you a chauffeur is to keep you from stealing. Why are you doing this to me?
Because I want to be as good a chauffeur as I am a stealer.
Well, there's a certain sincere logic in that I suppose.
I hope they shoot you! I hope they shoot you in my kitchen! And when they drag your dead body out of here, I hope they shoot you again!
Just keep saying to yourself, Aurora, only 12 more years to retirement.
What's that on your face?
What's what on my face?
This.
[Wiping car grease off her cheek]
Oh, that. That's barbecue sauce.
Black barbecue sauce?
Yes. It's mexican. Very hot. Don't eat it.
I wasn't going to.
Why am I always the last one in the neighborhood to get in bed with you?
My cousin's fighting; he's getting the crap kicked out of him.
At least he's working!
Will someone please remove this dog? He's dribbling on my briefs.
He was laying right there, dead as yesterday.
Glenda, the house looks lovely. What have you done to it?
We had it re-shingled.
Hot Damn! I finally get a chance to chase the po-lice!
He took the broom and went out the back door. He didn't say what he was going to clean up.
Oh sh**.
Well, maybe it was.
Is that the good Waterford crystal?
Yes, it was.
Nick, you mustn't do this. We're in the middle of soup.
The man sleeps under my bed, drives my car, and wears my tuxedo... I just want to meet him. Hold it right there. You're under arrest.
The police are on their way
Didn't like the chicken, huh?
Sorry.
[takes his seat]
Sorry.
[takes his seat]
Sorry.
[takes her seat]
I have a headache in my entire body.

[Reading Nick's note]
"There are some things a man has to do alone. This is not one of them so I'm going for help."
I think the three of us make a wonderful pair.
We're not even going to touch asphalt!
Rapido, rapido, niños!
Easy. Watch the license plate.
